title: 110_s1368
content: The Act may be cited as the "Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007" and outlines the authorities and duties of the Denali Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to include limitations on Commission members' federal employee status, grant the Commission the ability to use matching funds for approved projects, and make amendments to Commission personnel matters. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to include limitations on Commission members' federal employee status, grant the Commission the ability to use matching funds for approved projects, and make amendments to Commission personnel matters. The amendments include changes to the compensation and waiver options for Commission members. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to allow the Commission to appoint necessary personnel and terminate them as needed. Additionally, the Economic Development Committee section is revised to grant flexibility in decision-making by changing "shall" to "may". The Denali Commission is granted special functions under Section 3. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize a training program on careers related to infrastructure development in rural Alaska. The program will focus on construction, operations, maintenance, and management of Commission projects, as well as initiatives to encourage Alaskan youths to pursue careers supporting these projects. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to provide training for careers supporting Commission projects, including construction, operations, and maintenance for public infrastructure projects. Amounts made available to the Commission shall remain available until expended. The Commission is also required to address the housing needs of teachers in rural Alaska by assisting in housing development activities such as acquisition, rehabilitation, and new construction of housing. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2009 through 2014. The effective date for the amendments is upon enactment of the Act, with the authorization of appropriations taking effect on October 1, 2008.
